column4: something's wrong -- my whole file system is suddenly read-only. I tried to install the "devscripts" package, but something horribly went wrong. http://paste.ubuntu.com/350246/
During the installation, I got a prompts (blue thing with things to select). It said something about how do you get your mail, and I chose the default option, which was website or something like that
anyone know how to fix this?
I fail to see any reason why your files are read only in this paste
well, for one thing, I can't create a file in my home directory
and xchat is complaining that it's read only
Have you checked the permissions
furthermore, "dpkg: unable to access dpkg status area: Read-only file system"
can you write a file a s root?
No, I can't
Best thing to do is chroot in with a live disc and clean up the mess that way
nope :( http://paste.ubuntu.com/350255/
dpkg --configure libio-stringy-perl you try that
syockit: http://paste.ubuntu.com/350256/
any other ideas?
Not alot let to try except sudo dpkg --force all --remove
which package(s)?
sudo rm /var/lib/dpkg/info/libio-stringy-perl.*
ok, now i was able to remove libio-stringy-perl
can you repost the first pastebin I linked to? I need to remove all the dependencies manually of devscripts and don't know what they are
now what? http://paste.ubuntu.com/350262/
you nedd to dpkg reconfigure postfix now
well, it wouldn't reconfigure, so I removed it, but all seems well now :) http://paste.ubuntu.com/350264/
